summary: Full-stack web application called 'JEE WAR ROOM – Cognitive Performance Edition' for JEE Advanced 2026 preparation targeting AIR under 150. Features include real-time countdown (corrected to May 17, 2026), Focus Stability Index (FSI), performance analytics, consistency tracking, War Mode, comprehensive PCM chapter system with spaced repetition, daily goal tracker with study/work slots, and revision checklist. Dark-themed elite interface using React, Node.js, Express, MongoDB, and Chart.js. Fully optimized for Android mobile.
architectural_notes: Dark mode only UI with #0f0f0f background, neon blue/orange accents, minimal distraction-free design
React frontend with TailwindCSS optimized for dark theme
Node.js + Express backend with MongoDB database
Chart.js for data visualization (FSI, performance graphs, consistency tracking)
Top banner displays 'AIR <150. No excuses.' motivational text
Fully mobile responsive with smooth premium animations
Android-optimized responsive design with touch-friendly controls
Daily goal tracker integrates study slots and customizable work slots
Chemistry subject split into Physical, Organic, and Inorganic subsections in chapter system
All major actions use modal pop-ups instead of inline editing

existing_features.title: Implement dark mode theme with background color #0f0f0f, slightly lighter dark grey cards, neon blue and orange accent colors, and red glow for critical alerts. Include top banner displaying 'AIR <150. No excuses.' Ensure smooth premium animations throughout the interface.

Create a real-time countdown timer to JEE Advanced 2026 exam on May 24, 2026, 9:00 AM IST. Display days, hours, minutes, and seconds in large digital font with updates every second. Include subtext 'Time remaining to IIT Delhi'. Timer must automatically turn red when fewer than 30 days remain.

Implement Focus Stability Index (FSI) with score range 0-100 calculated using: 40% deep work hours, 20% task switching penalty, 20% distraction penalty, 10% sleep quality, and 10% War Mode usage. Display as circular progress indicator with color coding: Elite (80-100, green), Stable (60-79, yellow), Unstable (40-59, orange), Distracted (below 40, red). Include 7-day rolling trend line and warning alert if score declines for 3 consecutive days.

Build Performance vs Time graph dividing the day into 5 blocks (7-10 AM, 10-1 PM, 1-4 PM, 4-7 PM, 7-11 PM). Track accuracy percentage, completion rate, focus score, and average deep work duration per block. Display as dark-compatible bar chart with tooltips showing detailed metrics. Generate automatic productivity suggestions such as 'Schedule the most difficult subject during your peak slot' and 'Avoid weak topics during low-performance periods' based on performance data.

Create Consistency DNA Tracker with score range 0-100 calculated using: 40% study consistency (days studied in last 30 days), 20% PCM ratio maintenance, 20% revision adherence percentage, and 20% streak strength (no-missed-day streak). Display as animated vertical DNA-style bar with 30-day trend graph, volatility detection, and alerts for high inconsistency.

Implement War Mode feature with prominent 'ENTER WAR MODE' button. When activated, hide analytics and navigation panels, display only current task, countdown timer, and Pomodoro timer with 50-minute work / 10-minute break cycles. Darken background further and display motivational text 'Focus. Execute. Dominate.' Require confirmation before exiting. Track total War Mode hours in the backend.

Build Master PCM Chapter System covering full JEE Advanced syllabus for Physics, Chemistry (Physical, Organic, Inorganic), and Mathematics. For each chapter, implement status tracking (Not Started, In Progress, Completed, Revised Once, Revised Twice, Mastered), weakness tags (Weak/Moderate/Strong), mock test accuracy percentage, last revision date, and automatic next revision scheduling using 1-7-21 spaced repetition system. Include notes section for each chapter.
Ensure the entire application is fully mobile responsive with minimal, distraction-free interface optimized for focus and performance tracking on all device sizes.

Retry deployment of the complete JEE War Room application with all existing features: dark mode theme with #0f0f0f background, real-time countdown to JEE Advanced 2026 (May 24, 2026, 9:00 AM IST), Focus Stability Index tracking, Performance vs Time analytics with 5 daily blocks, Consistency DNA Tracker, War Mode with Pomodoro timer, and Master PCM Chapter System with spaced repetition

Create a daily goal tracker component that allows users to create and manage customizable time slots for study sessions and other work activities. Each slot must include: start time, end time, activity type (study/other work), custom description field where users can specify what task they need to do, completion status toggle, and ability to add/edit/delete slots throughout the day.

Build a revision checklist component that displays all PCM chapters from the Master PCM Chapter System organized by subject (Physics, Chemistry: Physical/Organic/Inorganic, Mathematics). For each chapter, show a checkbox to mark revision completion, last revision date, and visual indicator if revision is due based on the 1-7-21 spaced repetition schedule. Include bulk actions to mark multiple chapters as revised and filter view by subject or revision status.

Update the countdown timer component to target May 17, 2026, 9:00 AM IST as the JEE Advanced exam date instead of May 24, 2026. Ensure the countdown calculations and display accurately reflect this corrected date.

Enhance mobile responsiveness specifically for Android phone display by optimizing touch targets (minimum 44x44px), ensuring all interactive elements are easily tappable, implementing swipe gestures for navigation between tabs, adjusting font sizes and spacing for smaller screens, and testing that all features (daily goal tracker, revision checklist, FSI, analytics, War Mode, chapter system) render correctly and remain fully functional on Android devices with screen widths from 320px to 480px.

Fix the Focus Stability Index (FSI) calculation to accurately compute the score based on the documented formula: 40% deep work hours from War Mode sessions, 20% task switching penalty, 20% distraction penalty, 10% sleep quality, and 10% War Mode usage. Ensure the circular progress indicator and color coding (Elite 80-100 green, Stable 60-79 yellow, Unstable 40-59 orange, Distracted <40 red) display correctly with real-time updates.

Add functionality to the revision checklist allowing users to create custom chapters or units. Include input fields for chapter name, subject selection (Physics, Chemistry: Physical/Organic/Inorganic, Mathematics), difficulty level, and importance rating. Provide add, edit, and delete actions with proper form validation.

Add visual tick or cross indicators to each chapter in the revision checklist so users can mark chapters as completed or incomplete. Display a checkbox or toggle that shows a green checkmark when marked complete and a red cross or empty state when incomplete. Update the backend to persist these completion states per user.

Implement date-based validation in the Consistency DNA Tracker to restrict users to marking consistency status only once per day. Check the current date against the last recorded consistency entry date. If the user has already marked their status today, disable the consistency buttons and display a message indicating they can mark again tomorrow. Store the last marked date in the backend.

Refine the overall UI across all components to achieve a clean, elegant, and smooth aesthetic. Reduce visual clutter by optimizing spacing, using consistent padding and margins (minimum 16px between major sections), limiting the number of visible elements per screen, and ensuring typography hierarchy is clear. Apply smooth transitions (200-300ms) to all interactive elements. Fix any layout bugs causing overlapping content or misaligned elements, especially on mobile screens (320px-480px width).

Implement dark UI layout with background color #0f0f0f, slightly lighter dark grey for cards and panels, consistent padding and margins (minimum 16px between major sections), and smooth transitions (200-300ms) on all interactive elements. Optimize for Android devices with touch targets minimum 44x44px and mobile-responsive design for screen widths 320px-480px.

Create a unified Overview dashboard structure that consolidates chapter completion percentage, PCM ratio tracker, War Mode hours counter, and weak chapter alerts in a single screen. Do not include Focus Stability Index, Consistency DNA Tracker, revision module, Top PYQs section, or Performance vs Time graph.

Implement real-time countdown timer to JEE Advanced 2026 exam on May 17, 2026, 9:00 AM IST. Display days, hours, minutes, and seconds in large digital font with updates every second. Timer text and styling must automatically turn red when fewer than 30 days remain.

Split Chemistry subject into three separate sections in the chapter management system: Physical Chemistry, Organic Chemistry, and Inorganic Chemistry. Each section must maintain independent chapter lists with full CRUD capabilities.

Implement full chapter management system with modal-based editing. For each chapter, users must be able to edit chapter name, status (Not Started, In Progress, Completed, Revised Once, Revised Twice, Mastered), weakness level (Weak, Moderate, Strong), accuracy percentage, and last revision date through modal dialogs. Include delete chapter functionality with confirmation modal, and add custom chapter functionality with validation.

Implement dynamic chapter completion percentage calculation that updates in real-time as chapter status changes. Calculate completion percentage based on the number of chapters marked as Completed, Revised Once, Revised Twice, or Mastered divided by total number of chapters across all subjects (Physics, Physical Chemistry, Organic Chemistry, Inorganic Chemistry, Mathematics). Display the percentage prominently on the Overview dashboard and update immediately when any chapter status is modified.

Update the MasterPCMChapterSystem component to display revision tracking interface within each chapter card or detail view. Show three toggle buttons or checkboxes for Theory, PYQs, and Advanced Practice. Display the calculated revision coverage percentage (0-100%) for that chapter in real-time. When any revision field is toggled, immediately call the backend update endpoint and refresh the chapter data.

Update the OverviewDashboard component to display overall revision coverage percentage and subject-wise revision coverage breakdown. Add a new metrics section showing: Overall Revision Coverage (%), Physics Revision (%), Physical Chemistry Revision (%), Organic Chemistry Revision (%), Inorganic Chemistry Revision (%), and Mathematics Revision (%). All percentages must update in real-time when any chapter revision status changes without page refresh. Keep revision metrics visually separate from chapter completion percentage.

Create a new TopPYQsTracker component for the Overview dashboard. Display default PYQ years 2025, 2024, 2023, 2022 in a horizontal or vertical list. For each year, show a checkbox or toggle for completion status. Display year-wise progress indicator showing (completed years / total years) × 100%. Include an 'Add Custom Year' button that opens a modal for adding new PYQ years with validation. When any year completion status is toggled, immediately update the backend and refresh the display.

Add per-chapter PYQ status display within the chapter detail view in MasterPCMChapterSystem. For each chapter, show whether PYQs have been completed with visual indicator. This per-chapter PYQ status is linked to the chapter's pyqsCompleted field, which is separate from the global PYQ year tracking. Display this status alongside other chapter details (status, weakness, accuracy, revision date).

Implement React Query hooks in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts for all new revision and PYQ tracking endpoints. Create hooks for: updating chapter revision fields with optimistic updates, fetching overall and subject-wise revision coverage, fetching PYQ years list, toggling PYQ year completion, and adding custom PYQ year. Configure automatic query invalidation to refresh Overview dashboard metrics and chapter data when any revision or PYQ status changes.

Ensure that when a chapter is deleted, it is immediately removed from all revision coverage calculations (overall and subject-wise) and the UI updates in real-time to reflect the new percentages. The backend must recalculate and return updated revision coverage metrics after chapter deletion.

Add React error boundary component to catch and display JavaScript errors that prevent the application from rendering. The error boundary must wrap the root App component, display a user-friendly error message with details when errors occur, and provide a 'Reload App' button to attempt recovery.

Add comprehensive error handling and loading states to the App.tsx component. Wrap all authentication checks, actor initialization, and data fetching operations in try-catch blocks. Display loading spinner during initialization and show error messages if authentication or actor creation fails.

Verify and fix all React Query hooks in useQueries.ts to handle undefined actor states gracefully. Add enabled conditions to prevent queries from running before the actor is initialized. Ensure all mutations handle errors without crashing the UI.

Add defensive null checks and optional chaining to all components that depend on query data (OverviewDashboard, MasterPCMChapterSystem, TopPYQsTracker, RevisionChecklist). Ensure components render loading states or empty states when data is undefined instead of crashing.

Add console logging to track application initialization sequence. Log when main.tsx executes, when App component mounts, when Internet Identity initializes, when actor is created, and when first queries execute. This will help diagnose where the rendering breaks.

Ensure all CSS styles in index.css and Tailwind configuration do not cause rendering issues. Verify that background color #0f0f0f is properly applied, no styles set visibility:hidden or display:none on root elements, and no z-index issues hide the entire UI.

Verify all imports in App.tsx, main.tsx, and component files resolve correctly. Check that all imported components exist, paths are correct, and no circular dependencies exist. Add fallback exports if any imports fail.

Add fallback loading UI that displays immediately while the application initializes. Show a centered loading spinner with 'Loading JEE WAR ROOM...' text on the dark background to prevent users from seeing a blank black screen during initialization.

Add targeted error logging at critical initialization points in App.tsx to capture the exact failure during the 1-second loading period. Log when authentication initializes, when actor is created, when React Query queries execute, and any errors that occur during component mounting. Use console.error for failures and console.log for successful steps to trace where the rendering breaks.

Verify that all React Query hooks in useQueries.ts have proper enabled conditions that prevent queries from executing when actor is null or undefined. Add defensive checks to ensure hooks return loading states instead of attempting to call methods on undefined actors. Ensure all query functions handle actor initialization failures gracefully without throwing uncaught errors.

Verify that the ErrorBoundary component in ErrorBoundary.tsx is properly wrapping the App component in main.tsx. Ensure the error boundary catches all JavaScript errors during rendering, lifecycle methods, and constructors of the component tree below it. The error boundary must display a user-friendly error message with the error details and a 'Reload App' button instead of showing a black screen when errors occur.

Add try-catch blocks around the authentication initialization logic in App.tsx to catch any errors during Internet Identity setup or actor creation. If authentication fails, display an error message in the UI instead of rendering a black screen. Log the full error to console for debugging.

Verify that the loading spinner in index.html displays immediately on page load and remains visible until React successfully mounts and renders the App component. Ensure the spinner div is removed or hidden only after React takes control of the #root div. If React fails to mount, the spinner should remain visible with an error message appended below it.

Add 'ENTER WAR MODE' button to the OverviewDashboard component. Position it prominently near the top of the dashboard, styled with neon blue accent color to match the application theme. The button must be easily tappable on mobile (minimum 44x44px touch target).

Create a War Mode configuration modal component that displays when the 'ENTER WAR MODE' button is clicked. The modal must include a duration selector section with three preset buttons (60 minutes, 90 minutes, 120 minutes) and a custom input field for entering any duration in minutes. Style the modal with the dark theme background (#0f0f0f) and slightly lighter grey for the modal content area.

Add a 'Break needed?' toggle section to the War Mode configuration modal below the duration selector. Display two clear option buttons labeled 'Yes' and 'No'. When 'No' is selected, the break duration selector must be hidden. When 'Yes' is selected, show the break duration selector. Default selection should be 'No'.

Implement a break duration selector that appears conditionally in the War Mode configuration modal when 'Break needed?' is set to 'Yes'. Include preset break duration buttons (5 minutes, 10 minutes, 15 minutes) and a custom input field for entering any break duration in minutes. Use the same styling pattern as the focus duration selector.

Add a confirmation button to the War Mode configuration modal that displays a summary of the selected settings. When clicked, show a confirmation modal that previews: selected focus duration, whether break is enabled, and break duration (if enabled). Include 'Confirm & Enter War Mode' and 'Cancel' buttons in the confirmation modal. Clicking 'Cancel' returns to the configuration modal. Clicking 'Confirm' closes both modals without entering War Mode (War Mode screen not implemented yet).

Implement form validation for the War Mode configuration modal. Focus duration must be selected (either preset or custom with minimum 1 minute). If custom duration is selected, validate that it is a positive integer. If break is enabled, break duration must be selected with the same validation rules. Display validation error messages if requirements are not met when attempting to proceed to confirmation.

Ensure the War Mode configuration modal and confirmation modal are fully mobile-responsive with optimized touch targets (minimum 44x44px), appropriate spacing for small screens (320px-480px width), and no horizontal scrolling. All buttons, toggles, and input fields must be easily tappable on Android devices.

Create a new WarModeScreen component that displays when the user confirms War Mode entry from the configuration modal. The screen must render in full-screen mode, hiding all dashboard navigation and metrics.

Display a large countdown timer in the center of the War Mode screen showing the remaining focus duration in MM:SS format. The timer must update every second and count down from the user-configured focus duration.

Add Start, Pause, and Resume controls to the War Mode screen. Start button initiates the countdown. Pause button stops the timer without resetting. Resume button continues from paused time. Display only the relevant control based on timer state.
Display motivational text 'Focus. Execute. Dominate.' prominently on the War Mode screen below the countdown timer. Apply smooth fade-in animation when the screen loads.

Add an Exit War Mode button positioned at the top-right corner of the screen. When clicked, display a confirmation dialog asking 'Are you sure you want to exit War Mode? Your progress will be saved.' with Cancel and Confirm Exit options.

When the focus timer reaches 00:00, automatically trigger break mode if breaks were enabled in the configuration. Display a break countdown timer in the same format, showing motivational text 'Recharge. Prepare. Return Stronger.' during the break period.

After the break timer completes, display a 'Start Next Session' button that allows the user to begin a new focus session with the same duration settings, or an 'Exit War Mode' button to return to the dashboard.

Integrate the WarModeScreen component with the WarModeConfigModal. When the user clicks 'Confirm & Enter War Mode' in the confirmation modal, close all modals and render the WarModeScreen with the configured focus duration and break settings.

Track total active focus time in War Mode and persist it to the backend when the user exits or completes a session. Update the 'Total War Mode Study Time' metric on the Overview dashboard after each completed session.

Ensure the War Mode screen is fully mobile-responsive with optimized touch targets for Start, Pause, Resume, and Exit buttons (minimum 44x44px). The timer and motivational text must be clearly readable on small screens (320px-480px width).

Create full-screen WarModeScreen component that hides all dashboard navigation and metrics when War Mode is active. The component must receive focus duration and break configuration as props from the War Mode config modal.
Implement large countdown timer in MM:SS format that updates every second and counts down from the user-configured focus duration. The timer must maintain accurate state across pause/resume cycles.

Add Start, Pause, and Resume control buttons that appear contextually based on timer state. Only the relevant control should be visible at any time (Start when not running, Pause when running, Resume when paused).
Display motivational text 'Focus. Execute. Dominate.' prominently below the countdown timer with smooth fade-in animation when the War Mode screen loads.

Add Exit War Mode button positioned at the top-right corner of the screen. When clicked, display a confirmation dialog asking 'Are you sure you want to exit War Mode? Your progress will be saved.' with Cancel and Confirm Exit options.

Implement automatic transition to break mode when focus timer reaches 00:00, but only if breaks were enabled in the configuration. Display a break countdown timer in the same MM:SS format with motivational text 'Recharge. Prepare. Return Stronger.' during the break period.

Display 'Start Next Session' and 'Exit War Mode' buttons after the break timer completes. 'Start Next Session' should begin a new focus session with the same duration settings. 'Exit War Mode' should trigger the exit confirmation flow.

Track total active focus time during War Mode sessions (excluding break time and paused time). When user exits War Mode or completes a session, persist the accumulated focus time to the backend by calling the updateWarModeStats endpoint.

Update OverviewDashboard to display 'Total War Mode Study Time' metric that refreshes after each War Mode session completes. The metric should query the backend warModeStats and display total accumulated focus hours.

Ensure War Mode screen is fully mobile-responsive with optimized touch targets (minimum 44x44px) for all interactive elements. Timer and motivational text must be clearly readable on small screens (320px-480px width). Test and verify on Android devices.

Verify timer accuracy and state management throughout the War Mode lifecycle. Test pause/resume functionality, break transitions, session completion, and exit flows to ensure no timer bugs, state inconsistencies, or data loss occurs.

Add comprehensive error handling for War Mode timer operations and backend persistence. Display user-friendly error messages if timer initialization fails or backend calls to update study time fail. Ensure errors don't crash the War Mode screen.

Implement comprehensive BigInt-to-string conversion at the global serialization boundary in the API response handler layer. Create a utility function that recursively traverses all backend response objects and converts any BigInt values to strings before data reaches React Query cache or frontend state. This utility must handle nested objects, arrays, and null values safely.

Add BigInt serialization handling to all React Query hooks in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts. Wrap the query functions for useUserData, useChapters, useConsistencyData, usePerformanceBlocks, useTimeSlots, useWarModeStats, useRevisionCoverage, and usePYQYears to ensure all data is converted before being cached. Apply the same conversion to all mutation responses.

Implement safe JSON.stringify wrapper utility that handles BigInt values by converting them to strings before serialization. Replace all JSON.stringify calls in the frontend codebase (localStorage operations, logging, debugging) with this safe wrapper to prevent 'Do not know how to serialize a BigInt' errors.

Add defensive BigInt handling to the OverviewDashboard component. Ensure all numeric data (chapter completion percentages, revision coverage, War Mode hours, consistency scores) is explicitly converted to Number or string types before rendering. Add null checks to prevent accessing properties on undefined query results.

Add BigInt conversion handling to the MasterPCMChapterSystem component for all chapter data fields including status, accuracy percentages, revision dates, and numeric IDs. Ensure chapter edit operations and display logic safely handle all numeric data types without serialization errors.

Update the ErrorBoundary component in frontend/src/components/ErrorBoundary.tsx to catch and display BigInt serialization errors specifically. Add custom error messaging for serialization errors that guides users to reload the app, and log detailed error information including component stack and error type to console.

Add comprehensive console logging at critical initialization points to track the BigInt serialization fix effectiveness. Log when actor initializes, when backend responses are converted, when React Query caches data, and when components mount. Use console.error for any detected BigInt values that were not converted, and console.log for successful conversions.

Test the BigInt serialization fix comprehensively across all application flows: initial page load, chapter CRUD operations, War Mode entry/exit, revision tracking updates, PYQ year management, and consistency tracking. Verify that no 'Do not know how to serialize a BigInt' errors appear in console during any user interaction, and that all numeric data displays correctly.

Update the MasterPCMChapterSystem component to display three prominent toggle buttons or checkboxes for each chapter showing Theory, PYQs, and Advanced Practice completion status. Each toggle must visually indicate completion state with a green checkmark icon when true and a red cross or empty state when false.

Wire the revision tracking toggles to call the backend updateChapterRevision endpoint when any toggle is clicked. Pass the chapter ID and the specific field being updated (theoryCompleted, pyqsCompleted, or advancedPracticeCompleted) with the new boolean value.

Display the calculated revision coverage percentage (0-100%) for each chapter alongside the toggle buttons. The percentage must be calculated as (number of completed revision fields / 3) × 100 and update in real-time when any toggle changes.

Ensure the revision toggle UI integrates seamlessly with the existing chapter display layout in MasterPCMChapterSystem. Position the toggles prominently within each chapter card or expanded detail view without causing layout overflow or horizontal scrolling on mobile screens (320px-480px width).

Replace the existing DailyGoalTracker component with a new FlexibleScheduleGrid component that allows users to create unlimited time blocks with fully customizable start and end times (any duration, not limited to 1-hour slots). Each time block must include fields for: subject selection, chapter selection, topic description, priority level (High/Medium/Low), energy level (High/Medium/Low), completion status toggle, and notes. Users must be able to add blocks at any time of day, including outside 7 AM-11 PM range, and edit or delete any existing block.

Add daily progress tracking metrics to the FlexibleScheduleGrid component displaying: daily progress bar showing percentage of completed time blocks, PCM percentage tracker showing distribution of Physics/Chemistry/Mathematics blocks, deep work counter showing total minutes spent on completed blocks, current study streak counter (consecutive days with at least one completed block), and overall productivity score calculated from completion rate and deep work hours.

Create a SleepTracker component with manual daily input form for sleep data. The form must include a numeric input for hours slept (0-24 range with 0.5 increment support) and an optional sleep quality rating selector (1-5 scale with visual indicators). Display today's sleep entry if already logged, and prevent multiple entries per day with date-based validation. Show historical sleep data for the last 7 days with visual chart or list.

Enhance the existing FocusStabilityIndex component with a circular progress meter visualization displaying the FSI score (0-100) with color-coded rings (Elite 80-100 green, Stable 60-79 yellow, Unstable 40-59 orange, Distracted <40 red). Replace or augment the current display with this circular meter. Do not modify the existing FSI calculation formula.

Add a 7-day rolling trend line graph to the FocusStabilityIndex component showing FSI score changes over the last 7 days. Display historical FSI scores as connected line graph with date labels on x-axis and score values on y-axis. Include visual indicators for significant score changes between consecutive days.

Implement FSI drop alert system that monitors for 3 consecutive days of score decline. When FSI score decreases for 3 days in a row, display a prominent alert banner or notification in the FocusStabilityIndex component warning the user of the declining trend. Include suggested actions to improve FSI (increase deep work, reduce task switching, improve sleep quality).

Build an IntelligenceEngine component that implements a weakness detection algorithm analyzing chapter accuracy percentages and revision patterns to identify weak topics. Display a weakness report showing chapters with accuracy <60% or marked as 'Weak' status, prioritized by importance level. Include suggested focus areas based on upcoming revision due dates and exam proximity.

Add burnout detection algorithm to the IntelligenceEngine component that monitors deep work hours, consistency scores, sleep quality, and FSI trends to identify burnout risk. Display burnout risk level (Low/Moderate/High) with visual indicator. When burnout risk is detected, show alert with recommended recovery actions (reduce study hours, take rest day, improve sleep schedule).

Implement rank projection estimator in the IntelligenceEngine component that analyzes current chapter completion percentages, revision adherence rates, mock test accuracy, and time remaining until JEE Advanced 2026 to estimate projected AIR rank range. Display projected rank as range (e.g., 'Projected AIR: 120-180') with confidence level indicator. Include factors contributing to projection (chapter mastery, consistency, weak areas).

Add automated daily suggestions system to the IntelligenceEngine component that generates personalized recommendations based on performance data, upcoming revisions, weak chapters, and productivity patterns. Display 3-5 actionable daily suggestions such as 'Focus on Organic Chemistry Chapter 3 (revision due)', 'Schedule Physics problems during your peak 10 AM-1 PM slot', 'Weak area: Calculus - dedicate 2 hours today'. Suggestions must refresh daily.

Create an IntelligentAlerts component that monitors and displays three types of alerts: FSI drop alerts (when FSI declines 3 consecutive days), revision stagnation warnings (when no revisions completed for 7+ days), and deep hours threshold alerts (when daily deep work exceeds 10 hours without adequate breaks). Display alerts as prominent banners with critical red glow styling and dismiss functionality.

Integrate all new components (FlexibleScheduleGrid, SleepTracker, enhanced FocusStabilityIndex, ConsistencyDNATracker, IntelligenceEngine, IntelligentAlerts) into the existing App.tsx navigation structure. Create a new 'Intelligence' tab alongside Overview and Chapters tabs. Place FlexibleScheduleGrid and SleepTracker in Overview tab. Place enhanced FSI, ConsistencyDNATracker in Overview tab. Place IntelligenceEngine and IntelligentAlerts in new Intelligence tab. Ensure mobile swipe gestures work across all three tabs.

Update all React Query hooks in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts to support new data endpoints for time blocks, sleep tracking, FSI history, consistency DNA history, and intelligence reports. Implement hooks for: useTimeBlocks, useCreateTimeBlock, useUpdateTimeBlock, useDeleteTimeBlock, useSleepData, useCreateSleepEntry, useFSIHistory, useConsistencyHistory, useIntelligenceReport, useActiveAlerts. Configure automatic query invalidation to refresh dependent data when changes occur.

Ensure all new components and features maintain the existing dark theme with background color #0f0f0f, slightly lighter dark grey cards, neon blue and orange accent colors, and red glow for critical alerts. Apply consistent padding (minimum 16px), smooth transitions (200-300ms), and mobile-optimized touch targets (minimum 44x44px) across all new UI elements. Verify no horizontal scrolling on screens 320px-480px width.

Verify that all existing core systems remain unchanged: Chapter Management CRUD operations, Revision tracking core logic (theory/PYQs/advanced practice toggles), PYQ year tracker structure, War Mode base system with timer and break functionality. New features must only extend functionality without modifying these existing systems.

Remove the AIR rank projection estimator section from the IntelligenceEngine component. Delete all rank projection calculation logic, UI elements displaying projected rank range, confidence indicators, and contributing factors (chapter mastery, consistency, weak areas). Keep the weakness detection algorithm, burnout detection algorithm, and automated daily suggestions system intact.

Remove the SleepTracker component from the OverviewDashboard. Delete the SleepTracker component file (frontend/src/components/SleepTracker.tsx) and remove all imports and references to it in OverviewDashboard and other components.

Remove all React Query hooks related to sleep tracking from frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts. Delete useSleepData, useCreateSleepEntry, and any other sleep-related query hooks. Remove all references to these hooks throughout the frontend codebase.

Add a chapter name display field to each time block card in the FlexibleScheduleGrid component. Display the selected chapter name prominently below the time range (05:40 AM - 08:50 AM) and above or alongside the subject field. The chapter name should be clearly visible and styled consistently with the dark theme. Use a slightly lighter text color than the time display for visual hierarchy.

Update the time block data model in the FlexibleScheduleGrid component to ensure the chapter field is always populated when a time block is created or edited. If the chapter field already exists in the data model but is not being displayed, wire it to the UI. If it does not exist, add it to the time block form and backend storage.

Update the FocusStabilityIndex component to reflect the new FSI calculation formula without sleep quality. Update any UI text, tooltips, or help information that previously mentioned sleep as a factor in FSI calculation. Ensure the circular progress meter and color-coded rings continue to display correctly with the updated formula.

Daily goal tracker with customizable study slots and other work slots where user can decide tasks

Fix Focus Index calculation and display to work perfectly
